page.title: 09FARMING - HILL
page.content:
Steven Ligertwood Age 6
My dad is a shepherd and has to feed the sheep in winter with hay. We have five dogs. Two are collies and they round up the sheep for dad. We have three fox terriers that dad puts down fox holes to chase the foxes out and then he shoots any foxes that run away. He does a lot more besides being a shepherd. He shoots red deer stags and hinds. If the deer are low down on the hill near the road, he fires a shot from his rifle to frighten them back up the hill again. He fixes fences and also looks after the boat we have on the loch. It is used to carry any deer that he has shot by the side of Loch Ericht.He also has to be on the look-out for poachers. He has a ferret to catch rabbits. We like eating venison, trout and rabbits.
